IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE BAYLOR SCHOOL IS A CO-EDUCATIONAL DAY AND BOARDING COLLEGE PREPARATORY INSTITUTION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BAYLOR'S MISSION IS TO FOSTER IN ITS STUDENTS BOTH THE ABILITY AND THE DESIRE TO MAKE A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE IN THE WORLD.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION OF MIDDLE- AND HIGH-SCHOOL STUDENTS; APPROXIMATELY 1,055 TOTAL STUDENTS

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: BAYLOR SCHOOL IS DETERMINED TO BE A PUBLIC CHARITY BECAUSE IT IS A SCHOOL DESCRIBED IN SECTION 170(B)(1)(A)(II). SCHEDULE E HAS BEEN COMPLETED AND ATTACHED. FOR PURPOSES OF SCHEDULE A, THE ORGANIZATION HAS COMPLETED PART II IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THE SPECIAL RULE ON SCHEDULE B AND DISCLOSE DONORS GREATER THAN 2% INSTEAD OF ALL DONORS GREATER THAN $5,000.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: U.S. AND GLOBAL EX U.S. EQUITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 60 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES.

THE SCHOOL IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND RELEVANT STATE REGULATIONS. ACCORDINGLY, INCOME TAX EXPENSE IS LIMITED TO ACTIVITIES THAT ARE DEEMED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE TO BE UNRELATED TO THE SCHOOL'S EXEMPT PURPOSE.
CHANGE IN CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURANCE 32,516. CHANGE IN VALUE CSV CRT 28,129. BOOKSTORE COGS NETTED AGAINST BOOKSTORE REVENUE 305,700. LOSS ON PPE 198,044.
FINANCIAL AID REPORTED AS AN EXPENSE ON 990 6,378,575.
COGS NETTED AGAINST BOOK STORE SALES 305,700.
FINANCIAL AID REPORTED AS AN EXPENSE ON 990 6,378,575.
THE SCHOOL'S ADMISSION BROCHURES AND OTHER PRINTED MATERIALS INCLUDE THE NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY. THE POLICY IS ALSO INCLUDED ON THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE.

THE SCHOOL PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE SCHOOL. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON THE APPLICATION DATA AND CALCULATIONS FROM A THIRD PARTY VENDOR. ANY AWARDS ARE TREATED AS A CREDIT TOWARDS THE AMOUNT OF TUITION DUE. SINCE THE RECIPIENTS DO NOT HAVE CONTROL OF THE FUNDS AT ANY POINT, FORMAL MONITORING IS NOT NECESSARY.

THE SCHOOL PROVIDES HOUSING AND CERTAIN PERSONAL SERVICES RELATED TO THE MAINTENANCE AND CARE OF THE RESIDENCE AS PART OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S EMPLOYMENT. THIS IS PROVIDED FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE EMPLOYER SO THAT THE HEAD OF SCHOOL CAN PERFORM ESSENTIAL SCHOOL BUSINESS AND ACTIVITIES AT THE HOME. IN ADDITION, CERTAIN ADMINISTRATORS ARE PROVIDED WITH DISCRETIONARY SPENDING ACCOUNTS. THESE ACCOUNTS ARE TO BE USED FOR SCHOOL-RELATED EXPENDITURES AS SEEN FIT BY THE ADMINISTRATOR AND THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFUNDING NOTES & REVOLVING CREDIT LOAN; CAPITAL CONSTRUCTION & ACQUISITIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INTEREST RATE SWAP HEDGE TERM THROUGH YEAR 2032 PROVIDER: SUNTRUST BANK

CARTER LYNCH IS EMPLOYED BY PATRICK, BEARD, SCHULMAN, & JACOWAY, PC, THE SCHOOL'S PRIMARY ATTORNEY.RYAN CRIMMINS OWNS LAWSON ELECTRIC, WHICH HANDLES ELECTRICAL WORK AND REPAIRS FOR THE SCHOOL.JOHN STOUT IS A MANAGING PARTNER OF POINTER MANAGEMENT, LLC, A FINANCIAL INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT COMPANY. THE SCHOOL CURRENTLY HAS $16,711,775 INVESTED WITH POINTER AS OF FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHRISTOPHER P. CRIMMINS AND M. RYAN CRIMMINS HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP. ALEXIS G. BOGO AND ALEXANDER GUERRY, III HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY MANAGEMENT OF THE SCHOOL WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF ELLIOTT DAVIS, LLC/PLLC. A DRAFT FORM 990 AND ALL OF THE REQUIRED SCHEDULES ARE DISTRIBUTED TO THE VP OF FINANCE, WHO REVIEWS THE RETURN WITH ELLIOTT DAVIS, LLC/PLLC. ONCE THE DRAFT IS FINALIZED, IT IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES EVALUATES ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. IN THE EVENT OF A CONFLICT, THE BOARD WILL CONSIDER THE NATURE OF THE CONFLICT, AND IF WARRANTED, THE INDIVIDUAL IS ASKED TO RECUSE HIM/HERSELF FROM DISCUSSION AND VOTING. ALTERNATIVELY, IF THERE IS A POTENTIAL BUSINESS CONFLICT, THE BOARD MAY BE ASKED TO EVALUATE APPROPRIATENESS AND, IF NECESSARY, MANADATE A CHANGE TO OR DISCONTINUATION OF THE RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SETS THE COMPENSATION FOR THE HEADMASTER. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS DEEMED INDEPENDENT AS IT IS COMPRISED OF INDIVIDUALS THAT ARE NEITHER RELATED TO NOR SUBJECT TO THE CONTROL OF THE HEADMASTER. IN PREPARATION OF THIS DECISION, A COMPENSATION COMPARISON IS PREPARED USING DATA FROM THE NAIS. DATA IS PULLED AND ANALYZED USING A SET OF PREDETERMINED PEER SCHOOLS AND BENCHMARK SCHOOLS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL.
